treatment.description: Plants annual, usually monoecious (in some species, staminate flowers rare). Stems usually erect, not fleshy. Inflorescences terminal and axillary, ± long, cylindric spikes or panicles; axillary inflorescences similar to terminal ones, but shorter. Pistillate flowers: tepals usually (3–)5. Utricles transversely dehiscent (except A. bouchonii Thellung and some forms of A. spinosus and A. obcordatus).
treatment.global_distribution: one species perhaps native to Europe
